original: The methanol-to-olefin (MTO) process is a significant method for converting methanol into ethylene and propylene, two of the most widely produced chemicals in the petrochemical industry. These compounds serve as essential building blocks for the manufacture of various polymers, including low-density polyethylene (LDPE), high-density polyethylene (HDPE), and polypropylene (PP).
